alert.note: Alert for Hardin (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 2:20PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL HARDIN COUNTY THROUGH 245 PM EDT... At 220 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Kenton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Kenton, Blanchard, Mcguffey, Hepburn, Grant, Mentzer, Jumbo, Huntersville, Pfeiffer, Walton and Silver Creek. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. Residents in these areas should remain alert. If this storm becomes stronger, then a warning may be needed. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
